unnormalised: **Adaptive Learning: Is it the future of learning, yaar?**
normalised: So, I've been reading a lot about Adaptive Learning lately, and it seems like the thing in ed-tech right now. Basically, it's like having a personalized tutor for everyone, even if your school is as crowded as I I T Delhi on Convocation Day!

unnormalised: So, I've been reading a lot about Adaptive Learning lately, and it seems like *the* thing in ed-tech right now. Basically, it's like having a personalized tutor for everyone, even if your school is as crowded as IIT Delhi on Convocation Day!
normalised: The idea is that the system figures out what you already know (and what you don't!) through a series of questions and then adjusts the difficulty level accordingly. If you're struggling with trigonometry (like I did in class eleventh at D A V Public School, Delhi), it will give you extra help and simpler problems. If you're acing it, it'll move you on to more challenging stuff faster. No more wasting time going over things you already understand!
